solution_line_template: If James only missed one question in all five rounds of five questions, he correctly answered {rounds_played} * {questions_per_round} - {questions_missed} = <<{rounds_played}*{questions_per_round}-{questions_missed}={correct_answers}>>{correct_answers} questions
Before the bonus, James earned {correct_answers} correct answers * {points_per_correct} points/answer = <<{correct_answers}*{points_per_correct}={points_from_correct}>>{points_from_correct} points.

Since missing one question would only disqualify him from receiving a bonus in one round, he would earn a bonus for {rounds_played}-{questions_missed}=<<{rounds_played}-{questions_missed}={rounds_with_bonus}>>{rounds_with_bonus} rounds.
He should expect a bonus of {rounds_with_bonus} rounds* {bonus_per_round} points/round= <<{rounds_with_bonus}*{bonus_per_round}={total_bonus}>>{total_bonus} points.
Including his bonus, James scored a total of {points_from_correct} + {total_bonus} = <<{points_from_correct}+{total_bonus}={answer}>>{answer} points.
